wikipedia_page.main: Melanie Susan Potier (14 November 1947 – 23 June 1981), better known as Suki Potier, was an English model.

response: While on tour in 1965, Jones met Italian/German model and actress Anita Pallenberg backstage, and began a significant relationship with her. Pallenberg's bohemian fashion sense and connections to people like Andy Warhol were a major influence on Brian and the Rolling Stones. Jones was extremely abusive, at one point breaking his hand on Pallenberg’s face. In 1967, Anita left Brian for his bandmate Keith Richards. This added to tensions between Brian and Keith.  Brian had subsequent relationships with Suki Potier, and Swedish model Anna Wohlin, as well as a short relationship in 1968 with infamous American model and psychedelic It Girl Donyale Luna who lived in London and appeared with him in the Stone's 1968 'Rock n Roll Circus,' several months before his death. Wohlin was living with Brian in 1969 when he died, and has written two books about her time with him.

In 1942, Ho married Clementina Ângela Leitão, from the prestigious Portuguese Leitão family (Chinese:黎登)– her grandfather was a lawyer and Macau's only notary public at the time. They had four children. Leitão was involved in a motor vehicle accident in 1973, and suffered partial memory loss as a result. In 1981, Ho's and Leitão's son Robert and daughter-in-law Suki Potier died in a car accident. Clementina Leitão Ho died in 2004 and was buried in the St. Michael the Archangel Cemetery (Portuguese: Cemitério São Miguel Arcanjo).

On 17 December 1966, Browne was driving with his girlfriend, model Suki Potier, in his Lotus Elan through South Kensington at high speed (some reports suggesting in excess of 106 mph/170 km/h). He was under the influence of alcohol and other drugs at the time. Browne failed to see a traffic light and proceeded through the junction of Redcliffe Square and Redcliffe Gardens, colliding with a parked lorry. He died of his injuries the following day. Potier claimed that Browne swerved the car to absorb the impact of the crash to save her life.
*Suki Potier, Amanda Lear and Anita Pallenberg had small roles uncredited in the film as girls at a party.

response: Jones, recording engineer George Chkiantz, and Gysin travelled to the village in 1968, accompanied by Hamri and Jones' girlfriend Suki Potier to record the musicians using a portable Uher recorder.Palmer, Robert (December 19, 1971). "Music for a Moroccan Pan". The New York Times, at D35.Davis, Stephen (2001). Old Gods Almost Dead. Broadway Books, , 249–252.Wyman, Bill, with Coleman, Ray (1990). Stone Alone. Viking, , at 496–497. Jones worked on the two-track recordings in London, adding stereo phasing, echo, and other effects.Davis, Stephen (2001). Old Gods Almost Dead. Broadway Books, , at 253. Jones edited the full-band selection to 14 minutes by "cross-phasing fragments of a work that runs to some ninety minutes in uncut form". The album included three types of music: repetitive vocal chants "similar to those employed throughout Islam", flute and drum music featuring "several distinct melodic motifs and improvisations over a drone" played by two flutists and several drummers, and the full village orchestra's drum and horn music played to accompany the "frenzied dance of Bou Jeloud, a Moroccan Pan".
